citeinfo.title: Water use for hydraulic fracturing treatments in the Williston Basin, United States, 2000-2015

descript.abstract: Water used for hydraulic fracturing treatments in the Williston Basin during 2000-2015, was estimated using data reported in IHS Markit (2016). The treatment water volumes were converted to gallons and wells with volumes in unclear units were excluded from the analysis. The well completion date was used to assign treatment water volumes to a given year. The data were aggregated to a one square-mile grid. The aggregated data have been exported as annual GeoTIFF images and bundled into a TAR archive file.
descript.purpose: The aggregated data were used to assess the amount of water used for hydraulic fracturing treatments in the Williston Basin during 2000-2015. The data were used to simulate groundwater responses to increased withdrawals during a hypothetical 10-year drought using a transient groundwater model (described in USGS Professional Paper XXXX, available at http://pubs.usgs.gov/pp/XXXX/).

srcinfo.srccontr: IHS data were summarize in the one square mile gridded data sets presented herein

procstep.procdesc: Treatment water volumes for individual wells in the Bakken Play were collected from the IHS Markit (TM) database and aggregated to one square mile totals for the region of interest for the years 2000 - 2015. The resultant gridded data sets is: treatment_water - the volume of treatment water used per square mile per year. Data were converted from their original geodatabase format (a fishnet vector object containing 1 square mile polygons with attributes for the hydraulic fracturing treatment water for each year) to raster data (one raster for each year) using ArcPy. These rasters were then re-processed using gdalwarp to make their nodata values and datatype uniform.
